Subtask.1: ECS and AMG crew members perform PMCS on the vehicle per applicable TMs
Subtask.2: ECS crew members perform PMCS of the ECS and associated equipment per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1, other applicable TMs, and SOPs
Subtask.3: ECS crew members perform tactical weapon control computer unit diagnostics (TWUD)/baseline and fault recognition per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1
Subtask.4: ECS crew members perform lightweight computer unit (LCU) diagnostics and LCU initialization per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1
Subtask.5: AMG crew members perform AMG PMCS and associated equipment PMCS per TM 9-1430-603-10, TM 9-1430-1603-10, other applicable TMs, and SOPs
Subtask.6: EPP III crew members perform EPP III PMCS per TM 9-6115-757-13&P, TM 9-6115-668-13, and SOPs
Subtask.7: RS crew members perform PMCS on RS and associated equipment per TM 9-1430-1601-10-1, other applicable TMs, and SOPs
Subtask.8: LS, RS, and EPP III crew members perform PMCS on the HEMTT per applicable TM and SOPs
Subtask.9: LS and RS crew members perform PMCS on the M860A1 trailer per TM 9-2330-357-14&P and SOPs
Subtask.10: LS crew members perform LS PMCS and associated equipment PMCS per applicable TMs and SOPs
Subtask.11: LS crew members perform 15 kilowatt (KW) generator PMCS per TM 9-6115-643-10 and SOPs
Subtask.12: Missile reload crew members perform GMT PMCS per TM 9-2320-433-10 and SOPs
Subtask.13: BCP crew members perform PMCS on the BCP and associated equipment per applicable references and SOPs
Subtask.14: RSOP crew members perform PMCS of RSOP equipment per applicable TMs and SOPs
Subtask.15: Perform prepare for movement using drills 44-CW-D0011, 44-CW-D0012, 44-CWD0015, 44-CW-D0017, 44-CW-D0140, 44-CW-D0200, and 44-CW-D9002, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.16: Perform emplacement per drills 44-CW-D0001, 44-CW-D0009, 44-CW-D0010, 44-CW-D0016, 44-CW-D0023, 44-CW-D0130, 44-CW-D0190, and 44-CW-D9003, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.17: ECS crew members initialize the ECS per drill 44-CW-D0009; TM 9-1430-1600-10-1, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.18: ECS, BCP, and LS crewmembers establish and operate the battery communications net per communications plan and applicable TMs

Subtask.1: ECS crew members learn the function of all tabs and tabular entries per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1
Subtask.2: ECS crew members learn the fuctions of all controls, switches, and indicators per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1
Subtask.3: ECS crew members learn the situational display per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1
Subtask.4: ECS crew members learn fix or fight criteria per applicable manuals
Subtask.5: ECS crew members discuss evaluation decision and weapon assignment
Subtask.6: ECS crew members learn Patriot weapon system capabilities and limitations per (U) FM 3-01-.13 (S/NF), other applicable FMs and SOPs
Subtask.7: ECS crew members initialize the switch multiplexerunit per applicable references
Subtask.8: ECS and BCP crew members learn Patriot symbols per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1
Subtask.9: ECS and BCP crew members learn applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.10: ECS and BCP crew members learn to read and process United States message and test format (USMTF)/North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) formated air space tasticing order (ATO)/airspace control order (ACO)
Subtask.11: Crew members discuss alert states, STO, and ACO per applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.12: BCP crew members learn to input USMTF message and ACO information into the Patriot tactical planner workstation (TPW)
Subtask.13: BCP crew members load map data per TM 9-1430-608-14&P
Subtask.14: BCP crew members initialize the mulifunction information distribution system (MIDS) per TM 9-1430-608-14&P
Subtask.15: BCP crew member perform joint tactical terminal (JTT) power up, per TM 9-1430-608-14&P
Subtask.16: BCP crew member load crypto for the MIDS and JTT per TM 11-7021-223-10
Subtask.17: BCP crew members perform control and display unit power up
Subtask.18: ECS, BCP, and LS crew members conduct RFA drills, correctly configuring system for directed altert state per drill 44-CW-D0009, 44-CW-D-9003, and applicable SOPs

Subtask.1: ECS crew member create the site data book reflecting tabular settings and misison per applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.2: ECS crew members discuss defense design and factors which affect tabular entries
Subtask.3: ECS and LS crew members perform missile hazard/misfire procedures per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1, applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.4: ECS and BCP crew members conduct air defense operations using ATP 3-01.87 and the applicable TSOP and SOPs, and using ABML 1 through 5
Subtask.5: BCP crew members input defense plan per applicable TMs, TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.6: BCP crew members perform communications link planning per TM 9-1430-608-14&P
Subtask.7: BCP crew members establish and operate the BCP using applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.8: Missile reload crew members perform missile reload operations, per drill 44-D0150 and D0160, applicable TSOP and SOPs

Subtask.1: ECS and LS crew members perform missile hazard/misfire procedures per TM 9-1430-1600-10-1, applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.2: ECS and BCP crew members conduct air defense operations using ABML 6 through 9 scenarios
Subtask.3: Missile reload crew members perform missile reload operation, per drills 44-CWD0150 and D0160, applicable TSOP, and SOPs

Subtask.1: RSOP crew members conduct RSOP, using collective task 44-TM-9046, ATP 3-01.87, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.2: Perform prepare for movement drills as a battery, using drills 44-CW-D0011, 44-CWD0012, 44-CW-D0015, 44-CW-D0017, 44-CW-D0140, 44-CW-D0200, and 44-CW-D9002, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.3: Perform emplacement as a battery, using drills 44-CW-D0001, 44-CW-D0009, 44-CW-D0010, 44-CW-D0016, 44-CW-D0023, 44-CW-D0130, 44-CW-D0190, and 44-CW-D9003, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.4: ECS crew members perform initialization, using standard emplacement with mapping, per drill 44-CW-D0009; TM 9-1430-1600-10-1, applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.5: BCP crew members initialize the BCP per applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.6: Establish and operate the battery communications net per communications plan and applicable TMs
Subtask.7: ECS, BCP, and LS crew members conduct RFA drills, correctly configuring system for directed alert state per drill 44-CW-D0009, 44-CW-D9003, applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.8: Crew members perform maintenance sustainment operations, per applicable Army regulations, directives, pamphlets, and SOPs

Subtask.1: Crew members demonstrate proper performance of PMCS of their equipment as referenced in Table I tasks
Subtask.2: RSOP crew members conduct RSOP, using drill 44-TM-9046, ATP 3-01.87, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.3: Perform prepare for movement drills as a battery, using drills 44-CW-D0011, 44-CWD0012, 44-CW-D0015, 44-CW-D0017, 44-CW-D0140, 44-CW-D0200, and 44-CW-D9002, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.4: Perform emplacement as a battery, using drills 44-CW-D0001, 44-CW-D0009, 44-CW-D0010, 44-CW-D0016, 44-CW-D0023, 44-CW-D0130, 44-CW-D0190, and 44-CW-D9003, applicable TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.5: ECS crew members perform initialization, using standard emplacement with mapping, per drill 44-CW-D0009; TM 9-1430-1600-10-1, applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.6: BCP crew members initialize the BCP per applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.7: Establish and operate the battery communications net per communications plan and applicable TMs
Subtask.8: ECS, BCP, and LS crew members conduct RFA drills, correctly configuring system for directed alert state per drill 44-CW-D0009, 44-CW-D9003, applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.9: BCP crew members establish the BCP and conduct early warning operations per applicable mission orders, directives, TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.10: ECS and BCP crew members conduct air defense operations using an ABML 10 or 11 scenario, per applicable mission orders, directives, TSOP, and SOPs
Subtask.11: Submit required tactical reports per applicable TSOP and SOPs
Subtask.12: Perform missile reload operations per drill 44-CW-D0150, 44-CW-D0160, applicable TSOP, and SOP
Subtask.13: Crew members perform maintenance sustainment operations, per applicable Army regulations, directives, pamphlets, and SOPs
